title: Ex EastEnder Katie Jarvis says she has been a waitress and sold doughnuts to keep afloat as she praises Britain's working class
text:
Get the biggest soaps stories by email Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email

Katie Jarvis says she wants to stand up for working class people after explaining she's always had other jobs in between acting gigs.

The actress was starring in EastEnders as Hayley Slater until February, and is now working as a security guard at a B&M store in London.

After reports about her new job were published, Katie has explained how normal it is to "dabble" in other occupations.

Speaking on today's Victoria Derbyshire, she said: "All actors go through it over the years, I've had so many jobs in between and not just being a security guard.

"At 17 when I got Fish Tank I was doing doughnuts with my uncle at the time at festivals and things like that so I'd go on there and do the food carts.

(Image: BBC)

(Image: BBC)

"I've been a waitress, I've worked at a credit card company, I've done admin, I've done all types of things."

Mum-of-two Katie, 28, said she originally felt ashamed after seeing the papers, but that she soon realised she had nothing to be embarrassed about.

She also explained that she was now working alongside her sister, who is also a security guard at B&M, a job she says isn't easy.

She said: "One of my sisters she calls me a dabbler because I seem to do a bit of everything and I like to be busy and I like to learn new things, it doesn't matter what it is."

(Image: BBC)

She added: "The people I work with there are amazing, they get up every single day, they work hard for their money and it doesn't matter what job you're doing, I don't feel like anyone should be made to feel like how I felt when I woke up do you know what I mean, because I think as long as you're working that's all that matters."

Katie said being a security guard isn't easy.

She said: "A lot goes into being a security guard ,they put themselves at risk. I took that job on and joined my sister because she's a security guard there.

(Image: BBC)

"The way it as portrayed I need to stand up for them and the working class people because there's nothing wrong in any job."

Katie also said she was overwhelmed by the support she received from other actors, who spoke out to say they'd also done other things in between acting jobs.

Do you have a story to sell? Get in touch with us at webtv@trinitymirror.com or call us direct 0207 29 33033
description: The former EastEnders actress spoke out on Victoria Derbyshire today after reports about her working in a B&M store
